programs.name: Malaria
programs.description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease causing fever, fatigue, vomiting, and headaches.

programs.name: HIV/AIDS
programs.description: A chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus.

programs.name: Tuberculosis (TB)
programs.description: A serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs.

programs.name: Pneumonia
programs.description: Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.

programs.name: Diarrheal diseases
programs.description: Conditions characterized by loose, watery stools and frequent bowel movements.

programs.name: Malnutrition
programs.description: Condition resulting from eating a diet lacking in nutrients or not absorbing nutrients properly.

programs.name: Typhoid fever
programs.description: Bacterial infection causing high fever, abdominal pain, and headache.

programs.name: Hypertension (High blood pressure)
programs.description: A condition in which the force of the blood against artery walls is too high.

programs.name: Diabetes
programs.description: A metabolic disease causing high blood sugar levels over a prolonged period.

programs.name: Respiratory infections
programs.description: Infections that interfere with normal breathing, affecting upper or lower respiratory tract.

programs.name: Intestinal worms
programs.description: Parasitic worms that live in the human intestine and feed off the host.

programs.name: Schistosomiasis (Bilharzia)
programs.description: A disease caused by parasitic worms that live in certain types of freshwater snails.

programs.name: Dengue fever
programs.description: A mosquito-borne tropical disease causing severe flu-like symptoms.

programs.name: Hepatitis B
programs.description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
